intro: Galium kiapazi, commonly known as the mountain bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its flowering period is often accompanied by the presence of small, bead-like fruits that mature in the fall. Galium kiapazi thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows and forested slopes.
